name: Range
description: Range represents a set of one or more contiguous cells such as a cell, a row, a column, block of cells, etc.

properties.name: address
properties.description: Represents the range reference in A1-style. Address value will contain the Sheet reference (e.g. "Sheet1!A1:B4").

properties.name: addressLocal
properties.description: Represents range reference for the specified range in the language of the user.

properties.name: cellCount
properties.description: Number of cells in the range. This API will return -1 if the cell count exceeds 2^31-1 (2,147,483,647).

properties.name: columnCount
properties.description: Represents the total number of columns in the range.

properties.name: columnIndex
properties.description: Represents the column number of the first cell in the range. Zero-indexed.

properties.name: conditionalFormats
properties.description: Collection of ConditionalFormats that intersect the range.

properties.name: valueTypes
properties.description: Represents the type of data of each cell.

properties.name: format
properties.description: Returns a format object, encapsulating the range's font, fill, borders, alignment, and other properties.

properties.name: dataValidation
properties.description: Returns a data validation object.

properties.name: formulas
properties.description: Represents the formula in A1-style notation.

properties.name: formulasLocal
properties.description: Represents the formula in A1-style notation, in the user's language and number-formatting locale.  For example, the English "=SUM(A1, 1.5)" formula would become "=SUMME(A1; 1,5)" in German.

properties.name: formulasR1C1
properties.description: Represents the formula in R1C1-style notation.

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: Represents if all cells of the current range are hidden.

properties.name: rowHidden
properties.description: Represents if all rows of the current range are hidden.

properties.name: columnHidden
properties.description: Represents if all columns of the current range are hidden.

properties.name: isEntireColumn
properties.description: Represents if the current range is an entire column.

properties.name: isEntireRow
properties.description: Represents if the current range is an entire row.

properties.name: numberFormat
properties.description: Represents Excel's number format code for the given range.

properties.name: numberFormatLocal
properties.description: Represents Excel's number format code for the given range as a string in the language of the user.

properties.name: rowCount
properties.description: Returns the total number of rows in the range.

properties.name: rowIndex
properties.description: Returns the row number of the first cell in the range. Zero-indexed.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Text values of the specified range. The Text value will not depend on the cell width. The # sign substitution that happens in Excel UI will not affect the text value returned by the API.

properties.name: values
properties.description: Represents the raw values of the specified range. The data returned could be of type string, number, or a boolean. Cells that contain an error will return the error string.

properties.name: worksheet
properties.description: The worksheet containing the current range.

properties.name: sort
properties.description: Represents the range sort of the current range.

properties.name: hyperlink
properties.description: Represents the hyperlink for the current range.

properties.name: style
properties.description: Represents the style of the current range.

properties.name: linkedDataTypeState
properties.description: Represents the data type state of each cell.

methods.name: calculate
methods.description: Calculates a range of cells on a worksheet.

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Clear range values, format, fill, border, etc.

parameters.name: applyTo
parameters.description: Optional. Determines the type of clear action.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the cells associated with the range.

parameters.name: shift
parameters.description: Specifies which way to shift the cells.

methods.name: getEntireColumn
methods.description: Gets an object that represents the entire column of the range (for example, if the current range represents cells "B4:E11", its `getEntireColumn` is a range that represents columns "B:E").

methods.name: getEntireRow
methods.description: Gets an object that represents the entire row of the range (for example, if the current range represents cells "B4:E11", its `GetEntireRow` is a range that represents rows "4:11").

methods.name: getSurroundingRegion
methods.description: Returns a Range object that represents the surrounding region for the top-left cell in this range. A surrounding region is a range bounded by any combination of blank rows and blank columns relative to this range.

methods.name: getAbsoluteResizedRange
methods.description: Gets a Range object with the same top-left cell as the current Range object, but with the specified numbers of rows and columns.

parameters.name: numRows
parameters.description: The number of rows of the new range size.

parameters.name: numColumns
parameters.description: The number of columns of the new range size.

methods.name: getBoundingRect
methods.description: Gets the smallest range object that encompasses the given ranges. For example, the GetBoundingRect of "B2:C5" and "D10:E15" is "B2:E15".

parameters.name: anotherRange
parameters.description: The range object or address or range name.

methods.name: getCell
methods.description: Gets the range object containing the single cell based on row and column numbers. The cell can be outside the bounds of its parent range, so long as it stays within the worksheet grid. The returned cell is located relative to the top left cell of the range.

parameters.name: row
parameters.description: Row number of the cell to be retrieved. Zero-indexed.

parameters.name: column
parameters.description: Column number of the cell to be retrieved. Zero-indexed.

methods.name: getColumn
methods.description: Gets a column contained in the range.

parameters.name: column
parameters.description: Column number of the range to be retrieved. Zero-indexed.

methods.name: getColumnsAfter
methods.description: Gets a certain number of columns to the right of the current Range object.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Optional. The number of columns to include in the resulting range. In general, use a positive number to create a range outside the current range. You can also use a negative number to create a range within the current range. The default value is 1.

methods.name: getColumnsBefore
methods.description: Gets a certain number of columns to the left of the current Range object.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Optional. The number of columns to include in the resulting range. In general, use a positive number to create a range outside the current range. You can also use a negative number to create a range within the current range. The default value is 1.

methods.name: getResizedRange
methods.description: Gets a Range object similar to the current Range object, but with its bottom-right corner expanded (or contracted) by some number of rows and columns.

parameters.name: deltaRows
parameters.description: The number of rows by which to expand the bottom-right corner, relative to the current range. Use a positive number to expand the range, or a negative number to decrease it.

parameters.name: deltaColumns
parameters.description: The number of columns by which to expand the bottom-right corner, relative to the current range. Use a positive number to expand the range, or a negative number to decrease it.

methods.name: getIntersection
methods.description: Gets the range object that represents the rectangular intersection of the given ranges.

parameters.name: anotherRange
parameters.description: The range object or range address that will be used to determine the intersection of ranges.

methods.name: getIntersectionOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets the range object that represents the rectangular intersection of the given ranges. If no intersection is found, will return a null object.

parameters.name: anotherRange
parameters.description: The range object or range address that will be used to determine the intersection of ranges.

methods.name: getLastCell
methods.description: Gets the last cell within the range. For example, the last cell of "B2:D5" is "D5".

methods.name: getLastColumn
methods.description: Gets the last column within the range. For example, the last column of "B2:D5" is "D2:D5".

methods.name: getLastRow
methods.description: Gets the last row within the range. For example, the last row of "B2:D5" is "B5:D5".

methods.name: getOffsetRange
methods.description: Gets an object which represents a range that's offset from the specified range. The dimension of the returned range will match this range. If the resulting range is forced outside the bounds of the worksheet grid, an error will be thrown.

parameters.name: rowOffset
parameters.description: The number of rows (positive, negative, or 0) by which the range is to be offset. Positive values are offset downward, and negative values are offset upward.

parameters.name: columnOffset
parameters.description: The number of columns (positive, negative, or 0) by which the range is to be offset. Positive values are offset to the right, and negative values are offset to the left.

methods.name: getRow
methods.description: Gets a row contained in the range.

parameters.name: row
parameters.description: Row number of the range to be retrieved. Zero-indexed.

methods.name: getRowsAbove
methods.description: Gets a certain number of rows above the current Range object.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Optional. The number of rows to include in the resulting range. In general, use a positive number to create a range outside the current range. You can also use a negative number to create a range within the current range. The default value is 1.

methods.name: getRowsBelow
methods.description: Gets a certain number of rows below the current Range object.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Optional. The number of rows to include in the resulting range. In general, use a positive number to create a range outside the current range. You can also use a negative number to create a range within the current range. The default value is 1.

methods.name: insert
methods.description: Inserts a cell or a range of cells into the worksheet in place of this range, and shifts the other cells to make space. Returns a new Range object at the now blank space.

parameters.name: shift
parameters.description: Specifies which way to shift the cells.

methods.name: merge
methods.description: Merge the range cells into one region in the worksheet.

parameters.name: across
parameters.description: Optional. Set true to merge cells in each row of the specified range as separate merged cells. The default value is false.

methods.name: unmerge
methods.description: Unmerge the range cells into separate cells.

methods.name: replaceAll
methods.description: Finds and replaces the given string based on the criteria specified within the current range.
methods.signature: replaceAll(text: string, replacement: string, criteria: ReplaceCriteria)

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: String to find.

parameters.name: replacement
parameters.description: String to replace the original with.

parameters.name: criteria
parameters.description: Additional Replace Criteria.

methods.name: find
methods.description: Finds the given string based on the criteria specified.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: String to find.

parameters.name: criteria
parameters.description: Additional Criteria.

methods.name: findOrNullObject
methods.description: Finds the given string based on the criteria specified.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: String to find.

parameters.name: criteria
parameters.description: Additional Criteria.

methods.name: select
methods.description: Selects the specified range in the Excel UI.

methods.name: getUsedRange
methods.description: Returns the used range of the given range object. If there are no used cells within the range, this function will throw an ItemNotFound error.

parameters.name: valuesOnly
parameters.description: Considers only cells with values as used cells.

methods.name: getUsedRangeOrNullObject
methods.description: Returns the used range of the given range object. If there are no used cells within the range, this function will return a null object.

parameters.name: valuesOnly
parameters.description: Considers only cells with values as used cells.

methods.name: getVisibleView
methods.description: Represents the visible rows of the current range.

methods.name: showCard
methods.description: Displays the card for an active cell if it has rich value content.

methods.name: getImage
methods.description: Renders the range as a base64-encoded png image.

methods.name: getTables
methods.description: Gets a scoped collection of tables that overlap with the range.

parameters.name: fullyContained
parameters.description: If true, returns only tables that are fully contained within the range bounds. The default value is false.

methods.name: removeDuplicates
methods.description: Removes duplicate values from the range specified by the columns.

parameters.name: columns
parameters.description: The columns inside the range that may contain duplicates. At least one column needs to be specified. Zero-indexed.

parameters.name: includesHeader
parameters.description: True if the input data contains header. Default is false.

methods.name: setDirty
methods.description: Set a range to be recalculated when the next recalculation occurs.

methods.name: copyFrom
methods.description: Copies cell data or formatting from the source range or RangeAreas to the current range.
methods.signature: copyFrom(sourceRange: Range or RangeAreas or string, copyType: RangeCopyType, skipBlanks: bool, transpose: bool)

parameters.name: sourceRange
parameters.description: The source range or RangeAreas to copy from. When the source RangeAreas has multiple ranges, it must in the outline form which can be created by removing full rows or columns from a rectangular range.

parameters.name: copyType
parameters.description: The type of cell data or formatting to copy over. Default is "All".

parameters.name: skipBlanks
parameters.description: True if to skip blank cells in the source range. Default is false.

parameters.name: transpose
parameters.description: True if to transpose the cells in the destination range. Default is false.

methods.name: convertToLinkedDataType
methods.description: Converts the range cells into linked datatype in the worksheet.

parameters.name: serviceID
parameters.description: The Service ID which will be used to query the data.

parameters.name: languageCulture
parameters.description: Language Culture to query the service for.

methods.name: convertDataTypeToText
methods.description: Converts the range cells with datatypes into text.

methods.name: getSpecialCells
methods.description: Gets the RangeAreas object, comprising one or more rectangular ranges, that represents all the cells that match the specified type and value.

parameters.name: cellType
parameters.description: The type of cells to include.

parameters.name: cellValueType
parameters.description: If cellType is either Constants or Formulas, this argument is used to determine which types of cells to include in the result. These values can be combined together to return more than one type. The default is to select all constants or formulas, no matter what the type.

methods.name: getSpecialCellsOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets the RangeAreas object, comprising one or more ranges, that represents all the cells that match the specified type and value.

parameters.name: cellType
parameters.description: The type of cells to include.

parameters.name: cellValueType
parameters.description: If cellType is either Constants or Formulas, this argument is used to determine which types of cells to include in the result. These values can be combined together to return more than one type. The default is to select all constants or formulas, no matter what the type.
